name: The Craftsman
message: You care deeply about doing things right. You'll push back on shortcuts and build things that last. Watch out for perfectionism slowing you down.
strengths: You raise the quality bar for the whole team.
You spot long-term risks and edge cases early.
You can be trusted with complex, critical work.
growth_areas: You may delay shipping while chasing the ideal solution.
You can get frustrated when others accept trade-offs you disagree with.
You might avoid simpler approaches that are 'good enough' for now.

name: The Firefighter
message: You thrive in chaos and can ship under pressure. Startups love you early on, but make sure you don't burn out or leave a trail of tech debt.
strengths: You move fast when things are on fire.
You are willing to make bold calls under pressure.
You keep the team from getting stuck in analysis.
growth_areas: You may leave behind messy code and tech debt.
You might struggle to slow down for planning or documentation.
You can normalize crisis mode instead of preventing fires.

name: The Team Player
message: You keep the team aligned and avoid conflict. You're great at consensus-building, but sometimes you need to push harder for what you believe.
strengths: You build trust and psychological safety on the team.
You listen well and make others feel heard.
You help turn individual work into a coordinated effort.
growth_areas: You may avoid hard conversations to keep the peace.
You can over-index on consensus instead of clear decisions.
You might downplay your own technical opinions.

name: The Architect
message: You think in systems and see around corners. You're invaluable for scaling, but may frustrate founders who want speed over structure.
strengths: You design systems that can handle future growth.
You connect technical decisions to long-term consequences.
You are thoughtful about trade-offs and complexity.
growth_areas: You may over-engineer when a simpler solution would do.
You can be perceived as a blocker when others want to move fast.
You might prefer designing to actually shipping.

name: The Pragmatist
message: You balance idealism with reality. You know when to compromise. Just make sure you're not always the one giving ground.
strengths: You can adapt to what the situation really needs.
You are comfortable with 'good enough for now'.
You help the team keep moving instead of getting stuck.
growth_areas: You may accept too many compromises over time.
You might struggle to advocate for deeper technical investment.
You can be pulled in many directions by others' priorities.

name: The Challenger
message: You speak up and push boundaries. You make teams better through debate, but watch your toneâ€”not everyone sees conflict as productive.
strengths: You question assumptions and catch weak ideas early.
You are willing to raise uncomfortable truths.
You can drive technical and process improvements through debate.
growth_areas: You may come across as harsh or dismissive.
You can exhaust people who dislike frequent conflict.
You might underestimate the value of harmony and buy-in.
